channel.title: Infrastructure Club Travel Guide
channel.description: Latest places added to the travel guide

item.title: Added "Anti-Aircraft Battery Blantyreferme" in Blantyre, United Kingdom
item.description:
Remains of a gun battery from WW2.
See https://www.secretscotland.org.uk/index.php/Secrets/AABatteryBlantyreferme

item.title: Added "Anita Street Municipal housing development" in Manchester, United Kingdom
item.description: Late Victorian municipal housing development; was originally going to be named Sanitary Street, but the residents didn't like it and 'S' and 'ry' were dropped. When you are here, do also check out Victoria Square, the block at the eastern end of the street: the first example of municipal housing in Manchester.

item.title: Added "Anglesey Transport Museum & Café - Tacla Taid" in Caernarfon, United Kingdom
Added "Angels Flight Railway" in Los Angeles, United States
item.description: Funicular railway moved from its original location, now connecting the subway, Grand Central Market, and the ritzy office district of Bunker Hill.

item.title: Added "Anderton Boat Lift" in Northwich, United Kingdom
item.description:
Restored boat lift, still used to lift canal boats from one canal to another. Museum and visitor's centre, plus canal boat trips (including up and down the lift).
https://canalrivertrust.org.uk/places-to-visit/anderton-boat-lift-visitor-centre

item.title: Added "Anchor Church" in Sinfin, United Kingdom
item.description: A series of sandstone caves that have been carved into the rock. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anchor_Church

item.title: Added "Amundsen-Scott South Pole Station" in Grytviken, South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Added "Amphitheater of El Jem" in El Jem, Tunisia
item.description:
El Jem's Amphitheater and museum more than make up for the disappointment of Carthage, and it is well worth a special trip to see them.
The amphitheater is huge (3rd largest in the world), and at least has a little interpretation. You can climb all the way up to the highest levels and look down on the floor (and the town), and also explore the underground levels.
Honestly, it's better than the Roman Colosseum in many ways. Beautiful photography opportunities abound.
A 15 minute walk takes you to the museum, which is chock full of huge (room-sized) intact Roman mosaics. One of the best collections I've ever seen.
Worth at least an hour, two plus if you include the museum. A half day in El Jem is not out of order.
Added by grajohnt

item.title: Added "Amoreiras Mother of Water Reservoir" in Principe Real, Portugal
item.description: Recommend doing the tour of the Loreto Gallery, suggest booking in advance.

item.title: Added "Amgueddfa Lloyd George Museum" in Criccieth, United Kingdom
item.description: Lloyd George was founder of the welfare state. This is an opportunity to dress in Victorian costume, to play with period toys and to write on slate".

item.title: Added "Amberley Museum" in Arundel, United Kingdom
item.description:
Fascinating museum with exhibits including crafts, printing, buses, narrow gauge railway, telephones (including working telephone exchanges!) and more.
https://www.amberleymuseum.co.uk/

item.title: Added "Ambatovy (nickel mine)" in Moramanga, Madagascar
item.description: Notable for its size. Estimated to account for 25% of Madagascar's entire tax base. Waste fluids are piped 200 km to ponds at Toamasina, on the coast.

item.title: Added "Alter Elbtunnel" in St. Pauli, Germany
item.description: A tunnel under the river where vehicles enter massive elevators in order to get between tunnel and surface level.

item.title: Added "Altamont Pass wind farm" in Livermore, United States
item.description: Notable for being one of the first windfarms in the US.

item.title: Added "Alishan Forest Railway (Chiayi Station)" in Pizitou, Taiwan
item.description: The Alishan Forest Railway was originally constructed by occupying Japanese forces to facilitate logging; it's now a famously beautiful forest tour.

item.title: Added "Aldercrest-Banyon landslide site" in Kelso, United States
item.description: A very slow-moving landslide in 1998–99 that caused ~$100 million in damage. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aldercrest-Banyon_landslide

item.title: Added "Alcatraz Island" in Chinatown, United States
Added "Alaska State Museum" in Juneau, United States
Added "Alang Ship Scrap Yard" in Alang, India
item.description: Not the only shipbreaking area in the world but perhaps the most famous.

item.title: Added "Alan Turing Memorial" in Manchester, United Kingdom
item.description: Statue commemorating Alan Turing in the pleasant Sackville Street Gardens.

item.title: Added "Alameda Point Antiques Faire" in Chinatown, United States
item.description: Better known as the Alameda Flea. A vast open-air market on the even vaster disused runway of a former naval airbase, with views across to the Port of Oakland. Held the first Sunday of each month, with occasional changes to avoid major holidays or for weather. There is an entry fee. Serious shoppers are wise to arrive early, but it's an amusing stroll at any time of day.

item.title: Added "Alameda County Sheriffs Bomb Disposal Range" in Dublin, United States
item.description: You know it from “Mythbusters”.

item.title: Added "Alameda Beach" in Alameda, United States
item.description: Good though distant views of ships across the bay, the SF skyline, planes taking off from OAK, etc. Bring binoculars.

item.title: Added "Alabama Hills" in Lone Pine, United States
item.description: Surreal-seeming rock formations. Beautiful and (in summer) often extremely hot.

item.title: Added "Airworld Aviation Museum" in Llanwnda, United Kingdom
item.description:
Located on the airfield of the former RAF Llandwrog, the museum has an impressive collection of aircraft and aviation memorabilia. The museum offers the opportunity to get close up to some historic aircraft. Set on an active airfield, the museum houses iconic machines such as the Hawker Hunter, D.H. Vampire, along with the only T2 BAe Harrier remaining worldwide.
Part of the museum is devoted to the creation of the RAF Mountain Rescue Service, started here at RAF Llandwrog in 1942, whilst other sections describe the wartime airfields of North Wales

item.title: Added "Airmail Navigation Arrow" in Sandy Valley, United States
Added "Airbus UK Factory" in Broughton, United Kingdom
item.description: Large 'Beluga' planes come in to land here to bring/take parts of planes away - can be viewed from anywhere near the runway. Very occasional tours.

item.title: Added "Airbus Factory Tours" in Beauzelle, France
Added "Air Force Flight Test Museum" in Edwards Air Force Base, United States
Added "Ailsa Craig" in Girvan, United Kingdom
item.description: Quarried for curling stones, among other things https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ailsa_Craig#Curling_stones

item.title: Added "Afsluitdijk" in Den Oever, Netherlands
item.description:
Enormous dam closing off the Netherlands from the North Sea. There's a road across it.
https://theafsluitdijk.com/

item.title: Added "Aerospace Bristol" in Almondsbury, United Kingdom
item.description:
Aviation museum with lots of aircraft, other displays, and a Concorde.
https://aerospacebristol.org/

item.title: Added "Aeroplume flight in Grotte de la Samalandre" in Barjac, France
item.description: Want to fly a one-person helium-filled airship inside a cave? You can.

item.title: Added "Aerial tram (lower terminal)" in Portland, United States
item.description: A short but fun aerial tram, with good views. Unfortunately, there's not that much for a tourist to do on either end. Reasonably well connected to other transit, though.

item.title: Added "Acle Bridge" in Acle, United Kingdom
item.description: Exceptionally low bridge, always good fun to watch boats going through

item.title: Added "Aberystwyth Cliff Railway" in Aberystwyth, United Kingdom
Added "Abbotsbury Swannery" in Chickerell, United Kingdom
Added "Abbey Pumping Station Museum" in Belgrave, United Kingdom
Added "60 Hudson Street" in Tribeca, United States
item.description: Formerly known as the Western Union Building. A major colocation center.

item.title: Added "33 Thomas Street / Long Lines building" in New York City, United States
item.description: Windowless skyscraper containing major communication exchange points, and the likely location of an NSA intercept hub codenamed TITANPOINTE. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/33_Thomas_Street

item.title: Added "228 Peace Memorial Park" in Taipei, Taiwan
item.description: has some old steam trains

item.title: Added "مطار. اك الملح‎" in Rumāh, Yemen
item.description: www.wired.com/dangerroom/2013/02/secret-drone-base-2/

item.title: Added "Πολυχώρος Πολιτισμού "Ισλαχανέ"" in Ágios Pávlos, Greece
item.description: Old technical museum. Lovely stuff.

item.title: Added "Μουσείο Μαρμαροτεχνίας" in Tínos, Greece
Added "港の散歩道" in Nagasaki, Japan
item.description: Lookout point and large orange sphere. Cool to quickly look around. Added by Ed

item.title: Added "President Heads" in Williamsburg, United States
Added "Tomakomai West Port Ferry Terminal" in Tomakomai, Japan
item.description: Overnight ferry to sendai available, pain to book, but you can get a bedroom or pod, and can get a public bath on a moving ship.

item.title: Added "Snow Festival" in Sapporo, Japan
item.description: During February each year the park is taken over by huge snow carvings/statues.

item.title: Added "Sapporo TV Tower" in Sapporo, Japan
item.description: TV tower you can go up, has a mascot known as teli-dad https://yurukyara.fandom.com/wiki/Terebi_To-san

item.title: Added "Heavy Load-bearing Body" in Schöneberg, Germany
item.description: The Heavy Load-bearing Body is a giant concrete structure built to test how much load the ground in Berlin could hold to help with the Nazi plan to build a great big arch. It is quite a strange, squat concrete tower on an unassuming corner. Visiting hours are seasonal and they do guided tours daily. Entry is free. https://www.schwerbelastungskoerper.de/the-heavy-load-bearing-body.html
